research_context: Detecting credit card fraud in the finance industry by analyzing transaction datasets.
motivation: Improving the decision-making process in machine learning models by selecting relevant features to tackle data quality issues.
problem_statement: The need to compare different feature selection methods, specifically SHAP-value and importance-based methods, to determine which enhances model performance in credit card fraud detection.
additional_details: The study uses the Kaggle Credit Card Fraud Detection Dataset and evaluates the performance using five classifiers: XGBoost, Decision Tree, CatBoost, Extremely Randomized Trees, and Random Forest. The Area under the Precision-Recall Curve (AUPRC) is used as an evaluation metric.
